reflection.journey: Find what feels good. Set your intention. Start where you are, not where you used to be. Flexibility takes time and that's okay.

Trust really did end up suffucing this day. Trust that the adderall would have a good effect on my motivation; Trust my interview would got well; Trust in my ability to teach; Today felt internally calm and outwardly full. I really enjoyed it and want more.

I love ywA so much. Her quiet words make me think all through the practice. I know ADHDers should work on persistence vs. consistence but I crave routine. I think it is a part of my autism's need for state. I'm trying to work ywA into my dailies but really I want it in my mornings.
Focus on insight through repetition as I toast to intentional focus: exercise and movement help me feel less scattered. My yoga flexibility is increasing and that gives me warm fuzzies.
What are you opening up to? Adventure. I have a Sup and Sip scheduled and I panicked. I was excited before, but lost it and considered cancelling. Stay open. Go on the adventure. Make a plan for it.
I can really feel the benefits of this and see my progress in these practices. I'd hoped that this practice would loosen up my bowels and help me poop but I still needed a supository.
I need the simple and shorter practices and this provided that. The need to poop pressure is a lot though.
Finding inner support. It was really important to me to set today's tone for success. Right now is the right intensity for what I need.
I really want to do yoga before work and during lunch and now that I have my meds, today felt like the right time to start trying. Center, strength, and Harmony. It really worked out today.

It was really difficult to concentrate on such a slow and mild practice. I don't know how much was me and how much it being so slow. I didn't take my meds before and I felt it. I just want to have more focus in the evening so I'll try again tomorrow and see if a higher intensity helps my focus. If not I will need to rethink my goals and options.
